thread.title: Everything you need to know for the 59th Daytona 500
thread.title_full: Everything you need to know for the 59th Daytona 500

author: Brian
title: Everything you need to know for the 59th Daytona 500

organizations.name: getty images getty images flyover  u.s. air force thunderbirds

text:
Feb 26, 2017 at 9:36a ET 0Shares Happy Daytona Day! 
The 2017 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series season kicks off with the 59th annual Daytona 500 at 1 p.m. ET on FOX. 
Hendrick Motorsports drivers Chase Elliott and Dale Earnhardt Jr. will lead the field to green in the Great American Race. 
Here's everything you need to know to get ready for Daytona Day: Green flag 
The green flag will drop on the 59th Daytona 500 at approximately 2:30 p.m. ET. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Tune-in 
11:00 a.m. ET: "NASCAR RaceDay" (FS1) 
1 p.m. ET: 59th annual Daytona 500 (FOX) Mark J. Rebilas Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports Grid size 
Forty cars will be in the field for Sunday's race. , LAT Images www.latphoto.co.uk Russell LaBounty Track size 
Daytona International Speedway is a 2.5-mile D-shaped oval with 31 degrees of banking in the turns and 18 degrees of banking in the tri-oval. John David Mercer John David Mercer-USA TODAY Spor Stages and race distance 
Drivers will complete 200 laps and 500 miles in Sunday's Daytona 500. Under NASCAR's new race format, stages will end at Laps 60, 120 and 200. , LAT Images www.latphoto.co.uk Nigel Kinrade Forecast 
It will be a perfect day for racing in Daytona Beach, Florida, with a zero percent chance of rain and a high of 68 degrees. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports National Anthem 
Singer/actress Jordin Sparks will sing the National Anthem during pre-race ceremonies prior to the race. Getty Images Ethan Miller Honorary starter 
Former NFL running back LaDainian Tomlinson will wave the green flag for Sunday's 59th running of the Great American Race. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Honorary pace car driver 
Three-time Daytona 500 champion and current FOX NASCAR analyst Jeff Gordon will lead the field to green in a 2017 Chevrolet Camaro ZL1 before heading up to the TV booth to join Mike Joy and Darrell Waltrip. Grand marshal 
Actor Owen Wilson will serve as grand marshal for the 59th Daytona 500 and will give the 40-driver field the command to start engines. Getty Images Getty Images Flyover 
U.S. Air Force Thunderbirds will soar over the 2.5-mile superspeedway during pre-race ceremonies for the Great American Race. Defending race winner 
Denny Hamlin (11) beat Martin Truex Jr. (78) by 0.010 seconds to win his first career Daytona 500 in 2016. NASCAR NASCAR via Getty Images Michael's last ride 
Two-time Daytona 500 champion and FOX NASCAR analyst Michael Waltrip will be making his final NASCAR Cup Series start. Waltrip won the Great American Race in 2001 and '03. Daytona 500 front row 
Chase Elliott will start on pole for the second consecutive year in the Daytona 500. Elliott's Hendrick Motorsports teammate Dale Earnhardt Jr., making his return to full-time Cup competition, will start alongside him. Starting lineup
